column4: can somebody help me? i just did a fresh install of ubuntu but i think my software sources list may be broken. i can't check off "Important Security Updates (hardy-security)" in the gui
close the GUI, pastebin your sources.list
http://pastebin.com/m42903fb4 i've done some messing with it sine the problem occurred but this is what it looks like now
you want to disable -proposed.  But you've got security enabled (I'd also disable backports, but thats just me)
Does sudo apt-get update give you errors?
no, apt-get update doesn't return any errors
Well, I'd say you're all fine.  I have no idea what's up with software sources though.
alruight thanks for the help
ACtually, shouldn't that be security.ubuntu.com?  That's probably what the GUI is looking for (and why its not checked when you look)
line 51 was
hmm, try changing that to main restricted unvierse mutliverse (not that that should make a difference)
Just for yucks.  See if software sources likes that (and if it does, file a bug against it, and show how you fixed it, even if it odesn't, probably worthwhile to file a bug)
nope, still can't check it off
Very odd indeed.  Sounds like bugreport time.
but how can anyone reproduce this?
They probably can't, but the bug may still be find-able, and also if in a month someone else has the same issue, they'll find it, etc.
They'll ask for your sources.list, etc.  In theory its duplicatable.
is this my problem? https://bugs.edge.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/software-properties/+bug/244093
When you click it, go to Third party software, does security show up there?
yes it does
then yeah, that's your bug.  And legend2440 had already given us the workaround (or you can just wait, since it doesn't cause any problems except not showing the checkbox checked)
guess i'll jsut wait. thanks for the help
